name: Thai Mango Sticky Rice Recipe (Khao Niao Mamuang)
description: This Thai mango sticky rice is a classic dessert with ripe mangoes and a bed of perfectly steamed sticky rice.

itemListElement.text: Place your glutinous rice in a large mixing bowl. Cover it with water and let it soak for at least 4 hours, or even better, overnight.
itemListElement.name: Place your glutinous rice in a large mixing bowl. Cover it with water and let it soak for at least 4 hours, or even better, overnight.

itemListElement.text: After soaking, drain the rice and rinse it thoroughly, washing it at least 3 times to remove excess starch.
itemListElement.name: After soaking, drain the rice and rinse it thoroughly, washing it at least 3 times to remove excess starch.

itemListElement.text: Fill the bottom part of your steamer with water, about halfway full. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat.
itemListElement.name: Fill the bottom part of your steamer with water, about halfway full. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat.

itemListElement.text: Lay a steaming cloth on the bottom of the steamer tray. Spread the soaked rice evenly on the cloth, and then fold the edges of the cloth over the rice. Once the water is boiling, place the tray on the steamer. Cover with a lid and steam for 20 minutes. For detailed instructions, refer to my how to make Thai sticky rice recipe.

recipeInstructions.name: MAKE COCONUT SAUCE FOR STICKY RICE

itemListElement.text: While the rice is steaming, combine the coconut milk, sugar, salt, and pandan leaves in a pot or saucepan. Cook over medium heat.
itemListElement.name: While the rice is steaming, combine the coconut milk, sugar, salt, and pandan leaves in a pot or saucepan. Cook over medium heat.

itemListElement.text: Stir the mixture regularly while cooking. Continue until the sugar has completely dissolved, which should take about 3 minutes. Set this sauce aside until the rice is finished steaming.
itemListElement.name: Stir the mixture regularly while cooking. Continue until the sugar has completely dissolved, which should take about 3 minutes. Set this sauce aside until the rice is finished steaming.

itemListElement.text: Once the rice is done steaming, immediately transfer it to a mixing bowl. Pour the coconut sauce (from the previous step) over the rice.
itemListElement.name: Once the rice is done steaming, immediately transfer it to a mixing bowl. Pour the coconut sauce (from the previous step) over the rice.

itemListElement.text: Mix the rice and sauce thoroughly. Then cover the bowl and let the rice soak for about 20 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Mix the rice and sauce thoroughly. Then cover the bowl and let the rice soak for about 20 minutes.

itemListElement.text: In a separate mixing bowl, thoroughly combine coconut milk, salt, and rice flour.
itemListElement.name: In a separate mixing bowl, thoroughly combine coconut milk, salt, and rice flour.

itemListElement.text: Transfer this mixture to a pot and cook over low heat. Stir continuously until the sauce reaches your desired thickness.
itemListElement.name: Transfer this mixture to a pot and cook over low heat. Stir continuously until the sauce reaches your desired thickness.

itemListElement.text: Scoop the rice onto a serving plate. Arrange the mango around or on top of the rice. Drizzle the sauce over the rice and mango.
